lines:
1956

September 14, 1911.

air. S. C. Luk, 
20 Mellen Street,

Cambridge, Mass.

lễy dear Luk:

I have your letter of the 13th inst, and beg to thank you for 
writing me so fully and frankly of your plans. It seems to me that it

would not be altogether wise for you to carry so much money with you on so

long a trip, and hence I am sending you a check for $100. only, with the

understanding that additional and necessary funds will be forwarded to

you as soon as I hear from you of your arrival at the college. If you 
prefer you can have the bills sent direct to me, as this may relieve you

of unnecessary trouble in connection with them.

Wishing you every success under the new conditions, end hoping

to hear from you and see you occasionally, believe me,

Very sincerely yours,

Principal.
